filmography.title: The Private Life of Henry VIII
filmography.role_description: The gluttonous, boisterous, and often cruel monarch navigating his many marriages in the role that won Laughton the Oscar.
filmography.plot: King Henry VIII moves through his various wives, seeking a male heir and dealing with the political and personal fallout.

filmography.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
filmography.role_description: The tyrannical and abusive ship captain whose harsh discipline incites a mutiny led by his first officer.
filmography.plot: A tyrannical ship captain abuses his crew to the point of mutiny, led by his first mate, Fletcher Christian.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; NYFCC: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
filmography.role_description: The deformed and deaf bell-ringer of Notre Dame Cathedral who falls in love with a gypsy girl and protects her from the mob.
filmography.plot: In 15th-century Paris, the hunchbacked bell-ringer of Notre Dame tries to save a beautiful gypsy dancer from a corrupt official.

filmography.title: Witness for the Prosecution
filmography.role_description: An ailing, cantankerous, but brilliant barrister who defies his doctors to defend a man accused of murder.
filmography.plot: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Nomination – Best British Actor

filmography.title: Ruggles of Red Gap
filmography.role_description: A proper British valet who is won in a poker game by a rough-and-tumble American rancher and brought to the Wild West.
filmography.plot: An English valet is brought to the American West where he assimilates into the culture and recites the Gettysburg Address.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Les Misérables
filmography.role_description: The obsessive and unyielding police inspector who dedicates his life to hunting down the reformed convict Jean Valjean.
filmography.plot: In 19th-century France, a paroled convict seeks redemption while being pursued by a ruthless police inspector.

filmography.title: The Old Dark House
filmography.role_description: A bluff, nouveau riche industrialist stranded in a creepy mansion with eccentric inhabitants during a storm.
filmography.plot: Stranded travelers stumble upon a strange old house, and find themselves at the mercy of a highly eccentric and potentially dangerous family.

filmography.title: Island of Lost Souls
filmography.role_description: A mad scientist conducting horrific evolutionary experiments on animals on a remote island.
filmography.plot: A shipwrecked traveler discovers a remote island where a mad scientist conducts vivisection experiments to turn animals into humans.

filmography.title: The Sign of the Cross
filmography.role_description: The decadent, effeminate, and cruel Roman Emperor who persecutes Christians for his own amusement.
filmography.plot: A Roman soldier falls in love with a Christian woman during the reign of Nero, testing his loyalty to the Empire.

filmography.title: If I Had a Million
filmography.role_description: A meek clerk who, upon receiving a million dollars, calmly walks into his boss's office and blows a raspberry.
filmography.plot: A dying tycoon decides to give his money away to strangers, changing their lives in unexpected ways.

filmography.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
filmography.role_description: The tyrannical, possessive, and deeply repressed father of the poet Elizabeth Barrett.
filmography.plot: The invalid poetess Elizabeth Barrett defies her domineering father to marry the dashing poet Robert Browning.

filmography.title: Rembrandt
filmography.role_description: The famous Dutch painter portrayed through his years of success, tragedy, and eventual artistic isolation.
filmography.plot: A biography of the 17th-century Dutch painter, following him from the height of his fame to his lonely, poverty-stricken old age.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Jamaica Inn
filmography.role_description: A corrupt and eccentric squire who secretly leads a gang of shipwreckers and smugglers in Cornwall.
filmography.plot: A young woman discovers that her uncle heads a gang of ship-wreckers who lure ships to their doom on the Cornish coast.

filmography.title: They Knew What They Wanted
filmography.role_description: An aging Italian grape grower who proposes marriage to a waitress by mail, sending a photo of his handsome foreman instead of himself.
filmography.plot: A waitress agrees to marry a grape grower she has never met, only to discover he is not the handsome man in the photo.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (William Gargan)

filmography.title: It Started with Eve
filmography.role_description: A dying millionaire who recovers after meeting his son's fake fiancée, leading to a comedy of errors.
filmography.plot: A young man hires a hat-check girl to pose as his fiancée to please his dying father, who then unexpectedly recovers.

filmography.title: Tales of Manhattan
filmography.role_description: A poor composer and conductor who is given a second chance at success when he acquires a cursed tailcoat.
filmography.plot: An anthology film following a black tailcoat as it passes between different owners, affecting each of their lives.

filmography.title: This Land Is Mine
filmography.role_description: A cowardly schoolteacher in Nazi-occupied Europe who finds the courage to stand up for freedom and dignity.
filmography.plot: A timid schoolteacher in an occupied country is forced to take a stand against the Nazis and collaborators.

filmography.title: The Canterville Ghost
filmography.role: Sir Simon de Canterville / The Ghost
filmography.role_description: A cowardly 17th-century ghost who is doomed to haunt his castle until a descendant performs a brave deed.
filmography.plot: A cowardly ghost must help his American GI descendant perform a heroic act to break a centuries-old curse.

filmography.title: The Suspect
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered shopkeeper who murders his nagging wife and is pursued by a suspicious Scotland Yard inspector.
filmography.plot: A henpecked husband kills his wife and finds happiness with a younger woman, but a detective suspects foul play.

filmography.title: Captain Kidd
filmography.role_description: The infamous pirate who poses as a gentleman while burying treasure and eliminating his crew to keep his secrets.
filmography.plot: The ruthless pirate Captain Kidd tricks the King into commissioning him to escort a treasure ship, planning to steal it for himself.

filmography.title: The Paradine Case
filmography.role_description: A sadistic and lecherous judge who presides over a murder trial, displaying open contempt for the defense.
filmography.plot: A happily married lawyer falls in love with the woman he is defending against a murder charge, under the eye of a cruel judge.

filmography.title: The Big Clock
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical publishing magnate who commits a murder and then assigns his star reporter to find the killer, framing an innocent man.
filmography.plot: A magazine tycoon commits a murder and frames an innocent man, then assigns his best reporter to lead the investigation.

filmography.title: Arch of Triumph
filmography.role_description: A sadistic Nazi officer who torments refugees in pre-WWII Paris, becoming the target of a doctor's revenge.
filmography.plot: In 1938 Paris, a refugee doctor seeks revenge against the Nazi officer who tortured him.

filmography.title: Salome
filmography.role_description: The lustful and fearful King who is manipulated by his stepdaughter Salome, leading to the execution of John the Baptist.
filmography.plot: Princess Salome falls in love with a Roman commander and tries to save John the Baptist from execution.

filmography.title: Hobson's Choice
filmography.role_description: A drunken, tyrannical bootshop owner who tries to control his three daughters, only to be outwitted by his eldest.
filmography.plot: A tyrannical father is outmaneuvered by his eldest daughter, who marries his best employee and sets up a rival shop.

filmography.title: Spartacus
filmography.role_description: A wily, pragmatic Roman senator who maneuvers against the ambitious Crassus during the slave rebellion.
filmography.plot: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

filmography.title: Advise & Consent
filmography.role_description: A crafty, old-guard Southern senator who leads the opposition against a controversial Secretary of State nominee; Laughton's final film.
filmography.plot: A Senate investigation into a controversial Secretary of State nominee uncovers secrets and blackmail.
